description: guano +â€Ž -ine. Guanine was named by the German chemist Julius Bodo Unger in 1846 who isolated it from guano.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) A substance first obtained from guano; it is a nucleic base and pairs with cytosine in DNA and RNA (by means of three hydrogen bonds).
examples: Coordinate terms: adenine, cytosine, thymine, uracil
